page.title: 17Hemerdon - Bottle Hill.
page.content: We started at the top of Galva Road near Bottle Hill and we walked up to Drakeland Corner. We passed three houses called High Post, Plymview and Higher Drakelands. We could see Hemerdon Mine on the moor, rough grazing land and some woodland. High Post had a postbox in the wall out side. We then turned down the lane to Bottle Hill. On top of the hill was an old mining chimney for the arsenic fumes from the mine in the hill beneath. We passed over a bridge and saw a house with ducks and geese. There was a disused quarry and the hillside was covered in woodland. At the end of the lane was a field for grazing and Bottle Hill Quarry which is now used as a scrap yard. Julie Vincent.
